official-title.#text:
To establish a grant program to enhance existing secondary education programs for the purpose of
			 teaching high school students about the Constitution of the United States
			 and the constitutions of the individual States.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Education and the Workforce

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Constitution and Citizenship Day Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Constitution and Citizenship Day Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new subpart:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Part C of title II of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/t:II/pt:C

header.#text: Constitution Day and civic responsibility system for students
Establishment and operation of Constitution Day Grant Program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall establish and implement a grant program, to be known as the

shall award grants on a competitive basis to local educational agencies
			 and charter schools for the purposes of enhancing educational programs to
			 teach students about the United States Constitution and the constitution
			 of the State in which the grant recipient is located.

text.#text:
Grants under this section may only be awarded to a local educational agency or charter school with
			 established secondary educational programs to teach students about the
			 United States Constitution and the constitution of the State in which the
			 grant recipient is located.
An educational program funded by a grant under this section shall—

include efforts to reinforce existing Constitutional curricula conducted by the grant recipient;
			 and
make available to eligible students participating in such program the ability to register to vote.

A grant recipient under this section shall abide by all applicable State and Federal voter
			 registration laws.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall develop an application process for the grant program under this subpart,
			 consistent with the requirements of this section.

text.#text: An application for a grant under this subpart shall—
describe the educational activities to be funded by the grant; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
will be met, and any additional
			 assurances that the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:2371/ss:c

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
determines to be necessary to ensure
			 compliance with the requirements of this subpart.

text.#text: provide assurances that the requirements of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/t:II/pt:C/spt:6

			 through 2019
